quick_summary: Creates an exponential explosion of processes that freezes your computer in seconds. 1 becomes 2, 2 becomes 4, 4 becomes 8... until your system crashes. Hard reboot required.

parts.meaning: Define a function named ':' (colon) - the bomb itself
Function calls itself and pipes to itself - creates 2 copies
Run in background - allows unlimited parallel execution
Execute the function - lights the fuse

translation: Define a function that creates two copies of itself in the background, then execute it. Exponential process explosion ensues.
halloween_analogy: It's like a zombie virus that spreads exponentially. One zombie bites two people, those two bite four, those four bite eight... In minutes, the entire city is overrun and there's no stopping it. Your only option is to nuke the city (hard reboot).
safe_alternatives: NEVER run cryptic commands you don't understand
Set process limits: ulimit -u 1000 (limits processes per user)
If you see ':(){' or similar patterns, it's a fork bomb - don't run it!
Use virtual machines for testing suspicious commands
Modern systems have some protections, but they're not foolproof
Learn to recognize dangerous patterns before executing them
